definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder

sentences.english: Everybody must obey law and discipline.
The police‘s job is to maintain law and order of a country.
sentences.chinese: 警察的职责就是维持国家法纪。

sentences.english: That should put the fear of the law in any wayward person.
sentences.chinese: 这将使每个目无法纪之徒都对法律充满恐惧。

definition: with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to know the law and break it (idiom); consciously going against the rules
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to break the rules/to break discipline
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
